risks.Risk Description: A ubiquitous concern among organizations—with 78% of respondents rating it high or very high—reflecting significant threats associated with technological vulnerabilities.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Identified as a common factor driving high risks in cybersecurity, IT, and third‐party relationships.

risks.Risk Description: Risk arising from vulnerabilities in information technology systems that are not captured by other risk categories.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Technology is a key common driver, as IT risk is grouped with cybersecurity and third‐party risks.

risks.Risk Description: Risk arising from reliance on third-party service providers (often for IT services), which poses significant exposure in spite of relatively low audit frequencies.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Reliance on technology-driven third-party IT services increases exposure to associated risks.

risks.Contextual Variations: Perceived risk ratings are lower in publicly traded organizations compared to financial services organizations.

risks.Risk Description: Risk associated with meeting compliance and regulatory requirements, excluding internal controls over financial reporting (ICFR).
risks.Contextual Variations: Rated lower in publicly traded organizations compared to financial services organizations.

risks.Risk Description: Risk relating to potential disruptions or inefficiencies in day-to-day operational processes.
Risk related to the effectiveness of enterprise risk management programs and their associated processes.
Risk of fraudulent activities—a key focus area with almost 90% of respondents integrating fraud considerations into their audits.
Risk arising from deficiencies in organizational governance and cultural practices that adversely affect the control environment.
Risk related to internal controls over financial reporting—including Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) testing and compliance.
risks.Contextual Variations: In privately held organizations, risk perception and audit allocation differ markedly based on whether SOX is implemented.

risks.Risk Description: Risk associated with initiatives to reduce costs and expenses—identified as a considerably higher risk in nonprofit organizations.
risks.Contextual Variations: Nonprofit organizations rate this risk notably higher compared to other sectors.

risks.Risk Description: Risk relating to financial matters that are not encompassed by internal controls over financial reporting.
Risk related to sustainability and nonfinancial reporting, with a significant portion of respondents in both publicly traded and public sector organizations rating it as moderate to high.
risks.Contextual Variations: Over 60% of publicly traded respondents and 52% of public sector respondents consider this risk moderate, high, or very high.

risks.Risk Description: Risk concerning the effectiveness and support for external audit functions, noted by audit frequencies that are substantially higher than the perceived risk levels.
risks.Contextual Variations: Audit frequency for this area is approximately 45 percentage points higher than its risk rating.
